product_name: First Aid BeautyHydrating Eye Cream with Hyaluronic Acid
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackFirst Aid Beauty’s Hydrating Eye Cream with Hyaluronic Acid  hydrates for 24 hours while reducing the appearance of puffiness, fine lines and wrinkles.
details: DetailsBenefitsRich, nourishing cream texture absorbs instantlyHydrating formula with Hyaluronic Acid helps boost moisture levels and reduce the appearance of fine lines, wrinkles and crows feetHelps to reduce puffiness when massaged into under-eyeCucumber Extract provides a refreshing experienceLeaves skin feeling and looking refreshed, hydrated and happyKey IngredientsHyaluronic Acid: Boosts skin's moisture and reduces appearance of fine lines and wrinklesColloidal Oatmeal: Helps calm and relieve dry or distressed skinCaffeine: Helps reduce the appearance of puffiness and dark circlesCucumber Extract: Helps cool, calm and soothe skinResearch ResultsIn an independent clinical study with 42 participants: Provides 24 hours of hydrationn a consumer perception study with 49 participants after 4 weeks: 100% agreed their eye area felt nourished, calm, refreshed and hydrated immediately and all day 96% agreed this is the perfect everyday eye cream and works well alone or under makeupItem 2589260How To UseAfter cleansing skin, gently apply to the entire orbital eye area in the AM and PM.Recycling Instructions: Recycle carton with paper goods. Unscrew cap from tube, rinse both to remove excess product & recycle with plastics. Always check state & local recycling guidelines for specific instruction.IngredientsAqua (Water, Eau), Ethylhexyl Olivate, Prunus Armeniaca (Apricot) Kernel Oil, Butyl-ene Glycol, Cetyl Alcohol, Glycerin, Mangifera Indica (Mango) Seed Butter, Sodium Acrylates Crosspolymer-2, Cetyl Phosphate, Caffeine, Squalane, Hyaluronic Acid, Pan-thenol, Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) Fruit Extract, Avena Sativa (Oat) Bran Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Colloidal Oatmeal, Chry-santhemum Parthenium (Feverfew) Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Extract, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Caprylyl Glycol, Sodium Phytate, Sodium Polyglutamate, C20-22 Alkyl Phosphate, 1,2-Hexanediol, C20-22 Alcohols, Hydroxyacetophenone, Propanediol, Phenoxyethanol, Potassium Hydroxide.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: After cleansing skin, gently apply to the entire orbital eye area in the AM and PM.Recycling Instructions: Recycle carton with paper goods. Unscrew cap from tube, rinse both to remove excess product & recycle with plastics. Always check state & local recycling guidelines for specific instruction.

reviews.headline: Underrated!
reviews.comments: This product reduced redness on my lids and the hyperpigmentation became less noticeable. It also hydrated my under eyes so well. This product is truly underrated

reviews.headline: Awful!
reviews.comments: Wasn't hydrating at all. Burned when applied and lines were accentuated and made me look old!!!!

reviews.headline: Nice
reviews.comments: Absorbs fast. Light hydration. Glad no overwhelming scent. Like the tube also.

reviews.headline: Not Good
reviews.comments: At first I thought this cream was doing wonders, but shortly realized that this was the source of the styes I was getting. Would avoid this product if you have sensitive eyes

reviews.headline: This is my only eye cream now
reviews.comments: I have Dry Eye and use prescription medication. So many eye creams migrate into my eyes and burn. This one doesn't. I already bought another tube.

reviews.headline: Patchy
reviews.comments: This application part doesnt settle in well. It get clumps up and doesnt settle well with multiple cloncealers ive tried. Texture is very clay likw as well. After trying multiple eye creams this is the worst one in the last couple of years.

reviews.headline: This one does it!
reviews.comments:
I hate messing with eye creams and treatments. They're pointless. One is downright horrible. You can't move your face for 15 minutes after applying and you CANNOT apply it under makeup. It's like glue and foundation comes out highlighted under your eyes. 

THIS STUFF started as a sample from somewhere and I'm about to buy more from Ulta! It smells like cucumbers, it's light and it works. Give it only a week and your undereyes are perfectly smooth. I'm not lying. That's why I looked it up online. Forget real expensive products, maybe they have incredible results, too. But this does it for me

reviews.headline: Concealer doesn't settle in
reviews.comments: I have tried high to low priced eye creams looking for the best. This cream is perfect for my dry sensitive puffy under eyes. Concealer doesn't settle, not even after 15 hours of wear. Works for me.

reviews.headline: Cured my eyelid dermatitis!
reviews.comments: When I tell you I tried everything on mother's earth, I truly did. Nothing took the dryness and pain of my eyelid dermatitis besides this product. I am very sensitive to everything fragrance and this product WORKED!

reviews.headline: this didnt work for me
reviews.comments: i had high hopes bc it is first aid beauty but this eye cream didnt work for me. it burned my eyes whenever i would put it on and did not feel hydrating. also it smelt rlly bad im sorry. i have eczema prone skin around my eyes.

reviews.headline: Searched for a great eye cream and finally found one
reviews.comments: I love this product. I have bought a range of eyecreams looking one that achieved what it promised. Im so glad I found this one because it works extremely well on my dry puffy eyes and is also more affordable than many othet eye creams that charge a lot moreand do not give results. On my second purchase!

reviews.headline: wouldn't buy again
reviews.comments: I have tried other FAB products and liked...not loved...them.  Wanted a new eye cream, so picked this up.  It has an odd scent which had me thinking I bought an expired bottle.  Saw no difference in moisture or puffiness.  I wouldn't buy again.

reviews.headline: Not impressed
reviews.comments: During spring I get allergies/ hay fever etc. and it makes my skin very dry and irritated. Most products I use all year even irritate my skin, but this one did not. I will say it is soothing, and did not cause my skin to feel worse. So it would be good for those with senstive skin. However I did not notice a different with any darkness or puffiness. Not very impressed for the price of this, but not bad. Like it enough to keep it and use it, don't love it to buy it again.

reviews.headline: I'd buy it again
reviews.comments: It helps moisturize, and the cooling helps with puffiness. Havent seen extreme results but i love this companys skin care so gonna gove it a few more weeks.

reviews.headline: i would buy this again
reviews.comments: Works pretty good and is gentle on the eyes.  Iits hard to find an eye cream that doesn't irritate and cause me to have red eyes.

reviews.headline: Amazing
reviews.comments: Got this as a sample in a beauty subscription and WOW!   I've been using this for less than a week and can already see an improvement in my dark circles. Can't wait to get the full size and see the changes.

reviews.headline: Unfortunately hated it!
reviews.comments: I bought this and I was so excited but after about 3 days it completely ruined my under eyes. It took me 2 weeks to completely heal my eyes.

reviews.headline: Super impressed
reviews.comments: Was not expecting to love this so much. I used Strivectin eye creams for years and I think I'm switching to this permanently. It's a lightweight clear gel but super hydrating. It has a soothing/cooling effect that VISIBLY de-puffs my eye bags (hello insomnia). It really makes me look awake in the mornings, love it.

reviews.headline: My favorite and only eye cream now!! I'm impressed!!
reviews.comments: I have bought so many eye creams as I'm in my late 30s and noticed more under eye lines and crows feet coming in. I can finally stop searching for that eye cream because I have found it!! This stuff is awesome. Results were noticeable after 3 days.

reviews.headline: Still not sure
reviews.comments: I have used this product for days now. At first my under eye felt very moisturized.  Now on day 3 I am starting to notice a dry texture under my eyes. Not sure if I should keep using.

properties.name: Best Uses

values.label: Eye area, wrinkles, fine lines, hydration

display_values: Eye area, wrinkles, fine lines, hydration

faceoff_positive.comments: I received a sample size of this cream in my Ipsy bag and because I have sensitive skin around my eyes and am prone to eczema on my eye lids I was hesitant to try the cream.  I am so glad I gave it a try.  This is very gentle and has improved the skin around my eyes profoundly.  My eyelids went from crepey to smooth after using this for a couple of weeks.  I started out using it every other day and now use it daily.  I live in a dry, arid climate and this does a great job combating the elements.  I have had co-workers remark on the improved appearance.  Love, love, love this product.
faceoff_positive.headline: Great for sensitive skin

faceoff_negative.comments: I received a sample of this product and have been using it for four days. This eye cream has orange peel in it. The orange peel caused red irritation on my skin. Orange peel is sensitizing and should not be in skincare. I should have read the ingredients before using this product. The inclusion of orange peel totally defeats what this line is marketing itself as.
faceoff_negative.headline: Caused Irritation

rollup.name: Hydrating Eye Cream with Hyaluronic Acid
